titles: A copy of the late King James's letter, sent by the Earle of Melfort to the French king, on the last sea-fight And published the next day by the French King's order.
author: James II, King of England, 1633-1701.
notes: Concerns the destruction of the French fleet in May 1692. James begs Louis XIV to "forbear to concern yourself for a prince so unfortunate as I am: and give me and my family leave to retire unto a corner of the world".
The text begins: "Brother King, I have with a degree of resolution bore all the disgraces it had pleased Heaven to send me,...".
Reproduction of original in the Newberry Library.
keywords: James --  II, --  King of England, 1633-1701 --  Early works to 1800.
